name: ssddr
text: Ray sheepishly presenting the news to Teodor is great

name: apocowarg
text: It's okay, Ray. Get in the hot tub, fire up a spliff and listen to The Police. Soon you will be rich.

name: madnes
text: Is Ray holding the back of his neck. This is the canon gesture of bad-news bearing.

name: mustakrakesh
text: It is also the 'I fucked up' stance.

name: sargasm
text: Ray takes no prisoners.

name: mortshire
text: good to see ray's thong casual dress code again.

name: catgrl131
text:
Oh man, I would love to work in an office where the dress code is thong casual.

No wait, thats an awful idea!

name: mr_lostman28
text:
I would not mind working in this office.

what is the stance on "stuffing"?

name: boredom_man
text: have you seen such as in the company of men

name: tinhand
text: Teodor needs no words to express his disapproval.

name: rotating-dog
text: It is SO hard to get closure on the Todd account.

name: dzieger
text:
I have done this with the occasional client, but it takes quite a lot more abuse to get me to that point. Also, my work doesn't suck, so I'm at least a little justified.

Still, I gotta tell ya, it feels great. If you can get away with it, I highly recommend the experience.

name: shmuckeles
text: the tie-wearing cat is honest about his mistake

name: cousinted
text: Teodor's reactions are often what makes a strip.

name: cailetshadow
text: It took me awhile to learn not to do this in client meetings. The business world is tricky like that.

name: joeldobbins
text: The last panel was the first time I actually burst out laughing reading Achewood, and I just read this one for the first time tonight. =]

name: waddlerz
text: Ray could definetely work at my company

name: erincandy
text: I love how Ray feels inclined to mention that the reason they lost the account was that the logo needed more "Jazz" , and then the fact that he "called him a piece of shit and told him to fire us" was secondary. Also Teodor's reaction made me laugh out loud.

name: farqussus
text: No-one does righteous indignation like those losers who are ill-equipped to back it up with anything even vaguely resembling success.

name: plasticthings
text: the concept of a collared shirt tucked into a thong is almost as good as T�odor's final expression

name: pzukowski
text: Ah yes, this is just like the ad biz (and I speak from experience, unlike the rest of you babies).

name: rawk5tar
text: Hey fuck you man, I watch Mad Men too

name: irondave
text: I laughed my head off with this one.  I SO want to re-enact this with one of our customers some time.

name: stubob
text: Leave it to Ray to turn a half-hour solution into a permanent one.

name: deliciousmuffin
text: I think my favourite thing about this strip is actually the alt text. Probably because I was thinking something along those lines when I read the last strip.

name: ryanfuss
text: you guys ever do that sort of thing where you just swear at an annoying kid or something, and its really funny cause your gritting your teeth and leaning in at the time. Hella fun.

name: i_love_kate
text: Is anyone else terrified?

name: tekende
text: lol wut

name: puguglypress
text: Todd's logo is delightfully wack

name: wallabeechamp
text: OMG, the last two captions are hysterical!

name: random_shorts
text: This is the distinction between a MAJOR setback and a minor one. Ray was good to qualify that.
